feed.title: Michael Harley / obsolete29.com
feed.subtitle: Building web sites, infosec, hiking, biking, powershell, sharepoint, foosball.

entry.title: Hello world!
entry.content: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

entry.title: my blog-gah wtf
entry.content: Hi, my name is Michael Harley and I love the Internet. I’ve created this blog so I can have a place to write about topics that don't easily fit into 140 characters or are not appropriate for Facebook (family).

entry.title: Why I'm an atheist
entry.content: I enjoy talking about religion in general but a few specific events are prompting this blog post. First, my wife has recently been getting more involved with her church and we've been hanging out with her church friends, so church and religion and God has been a topic of conversation around here. Second, my daughter's boyfriend asked her why I didn't believe. Finally, one of my friends recently asked me why do I care about religion if I don't believe it.

entry.title: Death and dying
entry.content: I learned last night that a twitter friend of ours passed away on Monday. We weren't very close but it's made me ponder if I'm living my best life.

entry.title: My First Tattoo(s)
entry.content: I finally got my first (and second) tattoo over the past week. It's something I've always been interested in doing but I've waited because I knew that once I got started, I'd have to get tattoos until I was covered.

entry.title: Our Atheist-Christian marriage
entry.content: I'm an atheist and my wife is a Christian. How can this work you might ask? Well... it's not always easy. I can't speak to her perspective or experiences but I can speak to my own.

entry.title: Commuting: Why am I doing this?
entry.content: I live in a small town in Tennessee called Crossville. I work in Nashville, TN. That's 120 miles from my driveway to the office parking garage, one way. Why???

entry.content: Sometimes even allies can be at odds. Here's my recouting of one such occasion.

entry.title: PodCamp Nashville 2012
entry.content: Today was PodCamp Nashville 2012. Jen and I got to meet a bunch of people that we've only talked to on Twitter so that was a pretty big plus.

entry.title: Quick hit: death and dying
entry.content: More thoughts on death and dying and why wasting your my precious time on trivial things is so dumb

entry.title: Religious Freedom
entry.content: I think everybody has a basic fundamental right to religious freedom. I happen to think that religious freedom by definition has to include freedom from religion too.

entry.title: Junior Dee Harley
entry.content: This page will serve as a resource page for my dad, Junior Dee Harley.

entry.title: Concert Review: Butch Walker Nashville
entry.content: Wow. That's how I feel after seeing Butch Walker play at 12th and Porter last night in Nashville, TN. Here is my quick write up about our experience.

entry.title: SharePoint 2013 Sorry, you can't create a new item with Quick Edit because this view is missing one or more required columns.
entry.content: SharePoint 2013 Sorry, you can't create a new item with Quick Edit because this view is missing one or more required columns. To create a new item, please click "New Item" or add required columns to this view.

entry.title: Cycling the Natchez Trace
entry.content: In the fall of 2014, I took a week long cycle tour trip and rode my bicycle from Natchez MS to Nashville TN. Here is my write up.

entry.title: I'm learning web development
entry.content: I'm teaching myself web development and I'll be writing about my journey.

entry.title: Lessons learned from my time at Bridgestone
entry.content: After nearly 5 years with Bridgestone, I’ll be leaving the company because of restructuring. Since the announcement, I’ve reflected about my lessons learned that I can take away with me and onto my next opportunity.

entry.title: Please meet my cats
entry.content: If you follow me on Twitter, then you already know I have three cats. I'd like to introduce you to them now. Thank you.

entry.title: Leaning into Power Platform
entry.content: I have a confession. I'm a SharePoint Developer and I don't like Power Platform; I'd rather do it in PowerShell.
